segment.source: How to Configure VM Computer Name Pattern Properties
segment.target: How to Configure VM Computer Name Pattern Properties

segment.source: How to Configure VM Computer Name Pattern Properties
segment.target: How to Configure VM Computer Name Pattern Properties

segment.source: How to Configure VM Computer Name Pattern Properties
segment.target: How to Configure VM Computer Name Pattern Properties

segment.source: A virtual machine computer name pattern can be assigned both for revertible and for persistent MED-V workspaces.
segment.target: A virtual machine computer name pattern can be assigned both for revertible and for persistent MED-V workspaces.

segment.source: Revertible—Administrators can assign a unique name to each revertible MED-V workspace instance to differentiate between multiple computers using the same MED-V workspace.
segment.target: Revertible—Administrators can assign a unique name to each revertible MED-V workspace instance to differentiate between multiple computers using the same MED-V workspace.

segment.source: Persistent—In a persistent MED-V workspace, administrators can set a computer to be renamed during a setup script.
segment.target: Persistent—In a persistent MED-V workspace, administrators can set a computer to be renamed during a setup script.

segment.source: How to Assign a Virtual Machine Computer Name Pattern to a Revertible MED-V Workspace
segment.target: How to Assign a Virtual Machine Computer Name Pattern to a Revertible MED-V Workspace

segment.source: To assign a virtual machine computer name pattern to a revertible MED-V workspace
segment.target: To assign a virtual machine computer name pattern to a revertible MED-V workspace

segment.source: Click the revertible MED-V workspace to configure.
segment.target: Click the revertible MED-V workspace to configure.

segment.source: In the Revertible VM Setup section, select the Rename the VM based on the computer name pattern check box.
segment.target: In the Revertible VM Setup section, select the Rename the VM based on the computer name pattern check box.

segment.source: In the VM Computer Name Pattern section, enter the pattern to use for naming virtual machine images, using the following options:
segment.target: In the VM Computer Name Pattern section, enter the pattern to use for naming virtual machine images, using the following options:

segment.source: Constant—Enter free text that will be constant on all computers using the MED-V workspace.
segment.target: Constant—Enter free text that will be constant on all computers using the MED-V workspace.

segment.source: Variable—Enter a variable, by clicking Insert Variable, and select from one of the following:
segment.target: Variable—Enter a variable, by clicking Insert Variable, and select from one of the following:

segment.source: User name
segment.target: User name

segment.source: Domain name
segment.target: Domain name

segment.source: Host name
segment.target: Host name

segment.source: Workspace name
segment.target: Workspace name

segment.source: Virtual machine name
segment.target: Virtual machine name

segment.source: The variable selected will be specific to the computer using the MED-V workspace.
segment.target: The variable selected will be specific to the computer using the MED-V workspace.

segment.source: For example, if Domain name is selected, the unique name for each computer will include the computer's domain name.
segment.target: For example, if Domain name is selected, the unique name for each computer will include the computer's domain name.

segment.source: Random characters—Enter “” for each random character to include in the pattern.
segment.target: Random characters—Enter “” for each random character to include in the pattern.

segment.source: Each computer using the MED-V workspace will have a suffix of the length specified, which is generated randomly.
segment.target: Each computer using the MED-V workspace will have a suffix of the length specified, which is generated randomly.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The computer name has a limit of 15 characters.
segment.target: The computer name has a limit of 15 characters.

segment.source: If the pattern exceeds the limit, it will be truncated.
segment.target: If the pattern exceeds the limit, it will be truncated.

segment.source: On the Policy menu, select Commit.
segment.target: On the Policy menu, select Commit.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: A revertible VM computer name pattern can be assigned only when Rename the VM based on the computer name patterns (in the Revertible VM Setup section) is checked.
segment.target: A revertible VM computer name pattern can be assigned only when Rename the VM based on the computer name patterns (in the Revertible VM Setup section) is checked.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: A unique computer name can be assigned only if it is configured prior to MED-V workspace setup.
segment.target: A unique computer name can be assigned only if it is configured prior to MED-V workspace setup.

segment.source: Changing the name will not affect MED-V workspaces that were already set up.
segment.target: Changing the name will not affect MED-V workspaces that were already set up.

segment.source: How to Assign a Virtual Machine Computer Name Pattern to a Persistent MED-V Workspace
segment.target: How to Assign a Virtual Machine Computer Name Pattern to a Persistent MED-V Workspace

segment.source: To assign a virtual machine computer name pattern to a persistent MED-V workspace
segment.target: To assign a virtual machine computer name pattern to a persistent MED-V workspace

segment.source: Click the persistent MED-V workspace to configure.
segment.target: Click the persistent MED-V workspace to configure.

segment.source: In the Persistent VM Setup section, click Script Editor.
segment.target: In the Persistent VM Setup section, click Script Editor.

segment.source: In the Script Actions dialog box, click Add, and on the submenu, click Rename Computer.
segment.target: In the Script Actions dialog box, click Add, and on the submenu, click Rename Computer.

segment.source: Click OK to close the Script Actions dialog box.
segment.target: Click OK to close the Script Actions dialog box.

segment.source: On the VM Setup tab, in the VM Computer Name Pattern section, enter the pattern to use for renaming the computer, using the following:
segment.target: On the VM Setup tab, in the VM Computer Name Pattern section, enter the pattern to use for renaming the computer, using the following:

segment.source: Constant— Enter free text that will be included in the computer name.
segment.target: Constant— Enter free text that will be included in the computer name.

segment.source: Variable—Enter a variable, by clicking Insert Variable, and select from one of the following:
segment.target: Variable—Enter a variable, by clicking Insert Variable, and select from one of the following:

segment.source: User name
segment.target: User name

segment.source: Domain name
segment.target: Domain name

segment.source: Host name
segment.target: Host name

segment.source: Workspace name
segment.target: Workspace name

segment.source: Virtual machine name
segment.target: Virtual machine name

segment.source: The variable selected will be specific to the computer that is being renamed.
segment.target: The variable selected will be specific to the computer that is being renamed.

segment.source: For example, if Domain name is selected, the computer name will include the computer's domain name.
segment.target: For example, if Domain name is selected, the computer name will include the computer's domain name.

segment.source: Random characters— Enter “” for each random character to include in the pattern.
segment.target: Random characters— Enter “” for each random character to include in the pattern.

segment.source: The computer will have a suffix of the length specified, which is generated randomly.
segment.target: The computer will have a suffix of the length specified, which is generated randomly.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The computer name has a limit of 15 characters.
segment.target: The computer name has a limit of 15 characters.

segment.source: If the pattern exceeds the limit, it will be truncated.
segment.target: If the pattern exceeds the limit, it will be truncated.

segment.source: On the Policy menu, select Commit.
segment.target: On the Policy menu, select Commit.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The computer will be renamed only if it is set as an action in the Script Actions dialog box.
segment.target: The computer will be renamed only if it is set as an action in the Script Actions dialog box.

segment.source: For detailed information, see How to Set Up Script Actions.
segment.target: For detailed information, see How to Set Up Script Actions.
